title: Country-Fried Steak
description: A crisp, golden-brown breaded beef steak pan-fried and served with a creamy peppered milk gravy. Classic Southern comfort food with a crunchy crust and rich, savory sauce made from the skillet drippings.

ingredients.display_name: cube steaks (or round steaks pounded thin)
whole milk (for egg wash and gravy)
ingredients.notes: 1/2 cup in egg wash, 1.5 cups reserved for gravy
enough for shallow frying (about 3/4" in skillet)

steps.text: Prepare proteins: pat cube steaks dry, season both sides lightly with half the salt and half the pepper; if steaks are thicker than 1/4", pound to even thickness about 1/4" using a meat mallet between plastic.
Set up dredging station: combine dredge flour with remaining salt, remaining pepper and optional garlic powder in a shallow bowl; beat eggs with 1/2 cup milk in another dish.

Dredge steaks: lightly dust each steak with plain flour if desired, dip into egg-milk wash, then press into seasoned flour to coat thoroughly; shake off excess and set on a tray to rest for a few minutes.

Heat skillet and oil: warm a large heavy skillet over medium-high heat; add oil and butter and heat until shimmering and butter foams but does not burn (test with a pinch of flour â€” it should sizzle).

Fry steaks: working in batches to avoid crowding, add steaks and fry until golden brown and crisp, about 3-4 minutes per side; transfer to a wire rack or paper towel-lined sheet and tent loosely to keep warm.
Make gravy base: reduce heat to medium, carefully pour off excess oil leaving about 2 tablespoons of fat and any browned bits in the skillet; if needed add butter to equal 2 tbsp fat total.
Roux and deglaze: sprinkle the reserved 1/4 cup flour into the skillet and whisk continuously, cooking until the roux is golden brown and smells slightly nutty, about 1-2 minutes.

Add milk to form gravy: slowly pour in the remaining milk while whisking to avoid lumps; bring to a gentle simmer, reduce heat to low and simmer until thickened to gravy consistency, stirring frequently, about 5 minutes.

Season gravy and finish: season with additional salt and generous freshly ground black pepper to taste; if gravy is too thick, thin with a splash of milk. Return steaks to skillet briefly to warm through in the gravy if desired.
Serve: plate steaks topped with peppered gravy and garnish with chopped parsley; serve immediately with preferred sides.
